summary: The "enlargement of the Union" refers to the process by which the European Union (EU) expands its membership, inspired by the principles of integration and cooperation. This process serves multiple purposes, including the promotion of stability and prosperity among new member states. Legal frameworks, such as the acquis communautaire, guide recruitments and the integration of diverse economies, from the pliable floristry sector to the robust ingots industry. Notably, the enlargement can divertor resources, necessitating careful planning and fiscalis measures to ensure sustainability. Each accession is preceded by rigorous assessments, ensuring that candidates meet EU standards, thus reinforcing the linearity of EU regulations and policies.
